705413f-b.title: Brooklyn: Leonard Street - Maujer Street
705413f-b.text:
182-190 Leonard Street, east side, south frow Maujer Street. At the
N.E. corner of Leonard and Maujer Street is seen Public School No. 18.
October 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing demolishing to wake way for the Federal Housing
Program.
July 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

705620f-a.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705620f-a.text:
(1)
Maujer Street, east from Leonard Street, sho ing at the right,part-
ial erection of new apartment houses sponsored by the Federal Housing ad-
ministration. When this reconstruction is completed, a beautiful residen-
tial district will stand on what was once the sldms of Williamsburg.
February 1, 1937.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing alse in the background from left to right, two
steepled buildings, which are St. John's Evang. Lutheran Church and St.
Catherine's Hospital.
February 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, showing fully the east side of Maujer Street, partially
seen in views Nos. 1 \& 2. Viewed north on keonard Street from Ten Eyck
Street, is P.S. No. 18, old and new.
Pebruary 1, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
705620f-a.folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY

705618f-a.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705618f-a.text:
Maujer Street, east from Leonard Street. At the left, as far as the
eye can see, the old homes have been razed making way for new apartuuents
provided for by the Federal Housing Administration. At the left is Trand
Street, north side, east from Leonard Street aoross razed buildings. The
steeple of St. Catherine's Hospital is seen at the right background.
December 22, 1935.
'. L. Sperr.
NO REE ODUCTIONS.
705618f-a.folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY

705617f-a.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705617f-a.text:
Maujer Street, (left) east from Leonard Street, showing the foundations
upon which wdll be erected the Federal Housing Administration sponsored apart.
ments. Also seen from left to right, in the background, are St. John's
Evang. Lwtheran Church, and St. Catherine's Hospital.
August 10, 1936.
P. L. Snerr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
705617f-a.folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY

705622f-b.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705622f-b.text:
(1)
Maujer Street, north side, between Leonard Street and Manhattan
Ave., showing the new Public School No. 18 1the 4-story building at the
left), and the old building adjoining it. In the foreground, east of
Leonard Street, is Ten Eyck Street. Also seen at the left, is Leonard
Street, north from Ten Eyck Street.
December 22, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO RERODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view of the old building of P.S. No. 18,
and also in the foreground, the foundation work (on Ten Eyck Street),
for low rental apartment houses, made possible by the Federal Housing
Act.
September 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, showing the rebuilding on the south side of Maujer Street,
and from left to right in the background St. Johns Evangelical. JLhutheman
Church and 5t. CatWertnw's Hosnital.
November 27, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
705622f-b.folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY

705614f-a.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705614f-a.text:
Maujer Street, south side, east from Leonard Street. No. 88 Maujer
Street is the first one fronting on Maujer Street, with high steps.
October 25, 1934.
. L. SRerr.
) REPRODUCTION

705623f-a.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705623f-a.text:
Maujer Street, north side, between Leonard Street and Manhattan Ave.,
showing a northerly view towards Grand Street, and the rear of homes facing
Leonard Street and Manhattan Ave. View taken from Haujer Street. These
buildings were rased in 1935.
July 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
705623f-a.folder: Maujer Street & Leonard Street, Brooklyn, NY

705619f-a.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705619f-a.text:
Maujer Street, at the N.E. corner of Leonard Street. A view of a
section of P.S. No. 15, destroyed in 1935 under the Federal Housing Adminis-
tration, to make way for a modern school.
October 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

705621f-a.title: Brooklyn: Maujer Street - Leonard Street
705621f-a.text:
Maujer Street, between Leonard Street and Manhattan Ave., as see from
Leonard near Ten Eyck Streets. The 3-story brick building on the north side
of Maujer Street, was a part of P.S. No. 18, and was demolished in 1934.
July 30, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
